title: Rotational kinematics playground disk speeds up

content.question: A merry-go-round on a playground consists of a large, horizontal disk that can rotate about a vertical axis through its center. The disk is initially at rest and is given an angular acceleration <math alttext="alpha " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>α</mi></math> that varies with time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> according to the equation <math alttext="alpha equals C t minus D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>C</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>D</mi></math>, where <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>C</mi></math> and <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math> are positive constants with appropriate units and the positive direction is taken to be clockwise. Which of the following statements is true about the angular velocity of the merry-go-round at time <math alttext="t equals the fraction D over C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>D</mi><mi>C</mi></mfrac></math> ?

choices.label: It is at its maximum magnitude and in the counterclockwise direction.
It is at its maximum magnitude and in the clockwise direction.

content.answer: It is at its maximum magnitude and in the counterclockwise direction.
